revised_title: Investigating the Permeability of the Nuclear Envelope in Starfish Oocytes
tldr: Researchers discovered that the starfish germinal vesicle has a resting potential and ion channels on its surface. Using whole-cell voltage-clamp techniques, they found that the nucleus acts as an electrically isolated compartment that separates charged low molecular mass molecules, including inorganic ions. This study provides evidence that the nuclear envelope is selective and permeable to ions.
